item.title: On the amenable subalgebras of group von Neumann algebras
item.description: arXiv:2309.10494v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We approach the study of sub-von Neumann algebras of the group von Neumann algebra $L\Gamma$ for countable groups $\Gamma$ from a dynamical perspective. It is shown that $L(\Gamma)$ admits a maximal invariant amenable subalgebra. The notion of invariant probability measures (IRAs) on the space of sub-algebras is introduced, analogous to the concept of Invariant Random Subgroups. And it is shown that amenable IRAs are supported on the maximal amenable invariant sub-algebra.
item.dc:creator: Tattwamasi Amrutam, Yair Hartman, Hanna Oppelmayer

item.title: Simplicity of crossed products of the actions of totally disconnected locally compact groups on their boundaries
item.description: arXiv:2312.15754v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove that if a totally disconnected locally compact group admits a topologically free boundary, then the reduced crossed product of continuous functions on its Furstenberg boundary by the group is simple. We also prove a partial converse of this result.
item.dc:creator: Ryoya Arimoto
